item.title: Seagate ISE 8TB
item.description: Seagate 8TB ISE HDD NB: Disclaimer - This is not a review. Interesting drive for “deep and cheap” storage I have experience with many drive types. I have had some actually catch on fire in my data center before. When I see an interesting drive I will often review it or simply post about it for future reference for myself. In this case, a future possible reference for self-encrypting drives.

item.title: Ceph and SMR Drives - NO
item.description: Don’t use Ceph with SMR Drives! A while back at Ceph Day in NYC I saw a representative from a drive manufacturer talk about SMR drives. SMR stands for Shingled Magnetic Recordingand the analogy given was ‘think about the shingles on a house’. It sounded very interesting but they were not on the market at the time. A very active community member, Wido den Hollander, posted his findings here. The net result was DO NOT USE SMR DRIVES!
